name: NPR
text: Studies of inexpensive steroids, including the generic drug dexamethasone, have found that they can reduce deaths in patients hospitalized with serious cases of COVID-19. https://t.co/nuyF3fcqwU

name: NPR
text: The number of COVID-19 cases has increased by some 220% in Lebanon after the massive explosion at Beirut’s port, which forced 3 of the capital city’s major hospitals to close and partially damaged 3 others. https://t.co/vScMXeq44f

name: NPR
text:
Among the universe of young Republicans, research suggests that President Trump's appeal may have its limits.

"If we don't fix this right now within the party, we're going to have a problem going forward," says a 20-year-old student.
https://t.co/sj4EDwHHL0

name: NPR
text:
"In this instance of the Trump presidency, Trump's use of power is so unusual that we have a phenomenon here where the people around the president are trying to stop him," says New York Times reporter Michael Schmidt. (@nprfreshair)
https://t.co/aghElTavdy
